macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Raw response
items.summary: [{"title":"US Stocks Surge on Feb 6, Dow Tops 50,000 for First Time","summary":"Major US indexes rebounded strongly on Friday, February 6, 2026: Dow Jones rose 2.5% (1,206 points) to 50,115.67, S&P 500 gained 2% to 6,932.30, Nasdaq up 2.2% to 23,031.21, and Russell 2000 climbed 3.6%. The rally was driven by tech recovery, AI capex hopes, and improved consumer sentiment, though weekly losses persisted for S&P and Nasdaq.","source":"Barchart","url":"https://www.barchart.com/story/news/79531/how-ma

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Hyperliquid (HYPE) Surges 30% in Early 2026 Amid Market Downturn
items.summary: Hyperliquid has risen over 30% this year despite Bitcoin and Ethereum dropping more than 15%, driven by trading in crypto perpetual futures. New 'outcome contracts' for its platform could propel it 80% higher in 2026.

items.title: Crypto Market Cap Falls Below $2.4 Trillion After Two-Week Downturn
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization dropped below $2.4 trillion on February 7 following a downturn over the past two weeks. Stablecoin market cap remains high amid the decline.

items.title: Ethereum Reclaims $2,000 as Market Recovers $100 Billion to $2.4 Trillion
items.summary: Ethereum has reclaimed the $2,000 level while Bitcoin's recovery stalled at $72,000. The total crypto market cap rose over $100 billion from its recent multi-year low to $2.4 trillion.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI Announces Major Breakthrough in Multimodal AI Reasoning
items.summary: OpenAI has released a new model capable of seamlessly processing text, images, audio, and video simultaneously, achieving human-like understanding and a 40% improvement in multi-step reasoning tasks compared to previous models.

items.title: AI-Powered Systems Achieve 95% Accuracy in Early-Stage Cancer Detection
items.summary: AI diagnostic systems in healthcare are now detecting early-stage cancers with 95% accuracy, revolutionizing diagnostics as highlighted in the latest AI news.

items.title: New Reinforcement Learning Framework RLFKV Reduces Hallucinations in Financial AI
items.summary: Researchers from Ant Group developed RLFKV, a reinforcement learning method that verifies financial data at the atomic level, improving accuracy and faithfulness in RAG systems without human annotations.

items.title: Generative AI Advances in Decision Intelligence with Multimodal Models
items.summary: Early 2026 sees widespread adoption of multimodal generative AI models offering 40% improvements in cross-modal reasoning, enhancing scenario exploration and decision-making in complex workflows.

items.title: Initiatives to Reduce AI Bias by Addressing Wikipedia Representation Gaps
items.summary: Efforts like WikiProjects on women in art, architecture, and marginalized communities aim to counter AI biases stemming from Wikipedia's societal knowledge gaps, crucial as AI increasingly relies on open-access data.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo President Warns Memory Shortage May Impact Profitability
items.summary: Nintendo's president has stated that a long-term memory shortage could put pressure on the company's profitability, raising concerns about hardware production and supply chain challenges.

items.title: Ustwo Games Pivots to PC-First Strategy with Layoffs
items.summary: Ustwo Games has announced layoffs as part of a strategic shift toward a PC-first development approach, signaling a change in the studio's platform priorities.

items.title: Scopely Confirms Use of Generative AI in Star Trek Fleet Command Advertising
items.summary: Scopely has confirmed it utilized generative AI technology to create advertisements for its mobile game Star Trek Fleet Command, highlighting growing AI adoption in game marketing.

items.title: Blizzard Workers Ratify Union Contract
items.summary: Blizzard Entertainment workers have successfully ratified a union contract, marking a significant labor development in the gaming industry.

items.title: Roblox Forecasts Strong 2026 Bookings Above Wall Street Expectations
items.summary: Roblox has forecast fiscal 2026 bookings above analyst expectations, signaling continued strong growth in player spending and platform engagement.

items.title: Amazon Prime Gaming Announces February 2026 Free Games
items.summary: Amazon has announced eight free games for Prime Gaming subscribers in February 2026, including titles available on GOG and Epic Games Store, plus new GameNight multiplayer features.

items.title: Safe In Our World Launches 2026 Charity Bundle with 22 Games
items.summary: Safe In Our World has launched its 2026 charity bundle featuring 22 hit titles from developers including Landfall and Noodlecake, supporting mental health initiatives in gaming.

items.title: Microsoft Reportedly Expanding Xbox Game Pass in Early Development Stages
items.summary: Microsoft is in the early stages of expanding its Xbox Game Pass subscription service following last year's overhaul of tiers, pricing, and perks.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
